status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c1au","text":"Tissue preparation: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"718v1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dae1q","text":"Collect approximately 1 g of thallus tissue grown for 4-6 weeks under low light intensity (approximately 0.1 g of tissue per petri dish - 10 petri dishes in total). Figure1 and Figure 4.1","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":165,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tvf2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n36e","text":"Transfer the tissue into an empty petri dish,  add sterile water until the tissue is covered and fragment using a razor blade (it takes approximately 5 mins, similar to Video 1). Figure 4.2-3","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":179,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mdkb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hk86","text":"Transfer the tissue  from the petri dish into a cell strainer positioned on a falcon tube using sterile scalpels and wash the tissue using ~100 ml of sterile water or until the flow through was clear. Figure 4.4-6","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":201,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjsep","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"affle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1l0t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ok0p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0tkn","text":"Agrobacterium culture preparation:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uorq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgcio","text":"Inoculate 5 mL LB media with 3-4 Agrobacterium colonies (AGL1: 15 μg/mL rifampicin, 50 μg/mL carbenicillin) (GV3101: 50 μg/mL rifampicin, 25 μg/mL gentamicin) and the plasmid-specific selection antibiotic. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":57,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":109,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70v5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pp26","text":"Incubate the preculture at 28°C for 2 days at 110 rpm.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"giul","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4u12","text":"Centrifuge 5 mL of 2 d Agrobacterium culture (no need to measure OD) for 7 min at 2000 xg.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lfqc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p1bb","text":"Remove supernatant and re-suspend in 5 mL liquid KNOP plus 1% (w/v) sucrose and 100 μM acetosyringone.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qeri","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"he85","text":"Incubate the culture with shaking (120 rpm) at 28°C for 3-5 hours.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cr8q","text":"Co-cultivation:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"coqbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s2dn","text":"Transferred the fragmented thallus tissue into a 6-well plate (transfer 1⁄6 of the 1 g tissue into a single well) with 5 mL of liquid KNOP medium supplemented with 1% (w/v) sucrose and 30-40 mM MES (VERY IMPORTANT), pH 5.5, 80 μL of Agrobacterium culture and acetosyringone at final concentration of 100 μM.  Figure 4.7","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":185,"length":37},{"style":"bold","offset":309,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":233,"length":14},{"style":"sup","offset":308,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kasv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epvsr","text":"Co-cultivate the tissue with the Agrobacterium for 3 days on a shaker at 110 rpm, with only ambient light.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qcpt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhejh","text":"Using a sterile plastic pipette transfer the tissue of one well  into a cell strainer, drain and then transfer on growth media containing the appropriate antibiotic (onto 1 petri dish from one well).To facilitate spreading of the tissue, 1-2 mL of sterile water is added to the petri dish.  Figure 4.8-11","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":291,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eig6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r30d","text":"After 4-6 weeks successful transformants are visible on the petri dish (successful transformants can be identified using a dissecting scope after 4 weeks  selection (sometimes as early as 2 weeks) based on rhizoid production and/or fluorescence if such a marker is present on the construct).  Figure 4.12","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":293,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q8v9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5htsu","text":"The emergence of rhizoids is an indication of successful transformation (yellow arrow: transformed thallus fragment, blue arrow: dying thallus fragment).  Figure 5","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":155,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"385lh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Scale bars: 2 mm. Petri dish dimensions: 92 x16 mm.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1pn5b","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":65,"offset":0,"style":"UNDERLINE"},{"length":65,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"ce31m","text":"Tissue similar to the bottom images is optimal for transformation","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"Aa-Thallus-Oxford.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/6b589c7c54d4ac1f18daea5576525a4a949bf3c129764d863dd1c2835757774f/bwkwjbc6.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it5ajbc6.jpg","type":1,"webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it49jbc6.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34k6r","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f530b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F3366AC0134E11EDA8A4E955C637647B","height":506,"id":280424,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":39,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":13,"offset":299,"style":"italic"}],"key":"aeiub","text":"Figure 3: Transformation method outline. A) Thallus tissue is routinely propagated on a monthly basis under low light. 4-6 week old tissue is fragmented with the aid of a razor blade, transferred to a cell strainer, and washed thoroughly with sterile water. B) The tissue is then co-cultivated with Agrobacterium for three days (under low light) and C) spread on antibiotic-containing growth medium. After approximately 4-6 weeks, putative transformants are visible. A final round of selection is recommended to eliminate false-positive transformants.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fcicb","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8efrc","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"protocols-io.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it5kjbc6.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it5ijbc6.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it5jjbc6.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it5hjbc6.webp","width":550}}}}

agrestis Oxford thallus (this tissue is also good for To facilitate spreading of tissue on the petri dish  add 2 mL of sterile water. Grow at 21°C  under 12 hours light and 12 hours dark, 35 μmol m−2s−1 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":286,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":289,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68va6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep38o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hs59","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13g9g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvags","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"535pe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vrb3","text":"IMPORTANT: The light intensity used to cultivate A. agrestis tissue is a very critical factor for successful transformation. Tissue should be grown under low light intensity (3-5 μmol m−2s−1) and should have a morphology similar to the tissue in Figure 1 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":246,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":49,"length":12},{"style":"sup","offset":185,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":188,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
